title: 104_hr3645
content: The Act may be cited as the "National Environmental Education Amendments Act of 1996". The Office of Environmental Education is established. Section 4 of the National Environmental Education Act (20 U.S.C. 5503) is amended to include balanced and scientifically sound support. The Office of Environmental Education shall have a headquarters staff of up to 10 full-time employees and be supported by 1 full-time employee in each Agency regional office. The Administrator may carry out activities directly or through grants, agreements, or contracts. SEC. 3. ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION GRANTS amended to reduce funding for lobbying activities. SEC. 4. ENVIRONMENTAL INTERNSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS included balanced and scientifically sound support. The National Environmental Education Act is amended by striking sections 7 through 11 and redesignating them as sections 7 through 10. Conforming amendments include changes to the table of contents and references to specific sections within the Act. In amending the National Environmental Education Act, sections 7 through 11 are redesignated as sections 7 through 10. Changes include updating references within the Act. SEC. 5. National Education Awards. The Administrator may provide awards known as the 'President's Environmental Youth Awards' to students in grades K-12 for outstanding projects promoting local environmental awareness. SEC. 6. Environmental Education Advisory Council and Task Force. Section 8 of the National Environmental Education Act is amended to specify the composition of the Advisory Council and Task Force, including the sectors represented and the eligibility criteria for membership. The Advisory Council under the National Environmental Education Act will now hold biennial meetings on timely issues and provide recommendations in a report. SEC. 7. NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOUNDATION. The name "National Environmental Education and Training Foundation" is changed to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in various sections of the National Environmental Education Act. The name "National Environmental Education and Training Foundation" is changed to "Foundation for Environmental Education" in different sections of the National Environmental Education Act, including the Board of Directors and Conditions of Donations. The Environmental Education Act is amended by striking paragraph (3) in subsection (d). SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for fiscal years 1997 to 2007. Funds are allocated for various environmental education activities, with specific limitations on their use. The National Environmental Education Act authorizes appropriations to the Environmental Protection Agency for environmental education activities, with a limit of 25% for administrative expenses. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as of either October 1, 1996, or the date of enactment of this Act.
